main.name: Kevin Gastelum
main.occupation: Developer/Data Analyst aspiring to be a Data Scientist
main.description: With experience working with programming languages such as Python, SQL, Javascript, R, and Lua
main.bio: Went to college for Computer Networking and have previous work experience in the field but found a greater passion in learning how to code. I enjoy working with numbers, managing data, problem-solving and have found Data Analysis to be the perfect field to hone my skills in.

resume.skillmessage: Short write-up of my skills to show off to employers

education.description: In depth Pytorch course taught by Daniel Bourke covering intro to tensors: tensor datatypes, tensor operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) common tensor errors, tensor aggregation, shaping, stacking, squeezing, unsqueezing and tensor indexing. Overview of data prepping for Pytorch: converting data into tensors. Building a model: hidden layers, hidden neurons, forward pass, loss function, and optimizers. Training a model: creating a train/test loop, using an activation function and optimizing predictions.

Have not been to a University yet... but I've been able to acquire all of my skills online for free thanks to the internet! I have acquired Math skills such as Geometry, Algebra, Trigonometry, Statistics & Probability and Linear Algebra from websites like Khan Academy, Brilliant and Math trainer. I've also Learned how to code in Python, SQL, and Javascript by following courses on EDX, Coursera and Udemy as well as Youtube channels like FreeCodeCamp, CS Dojo, Python Engineer, Derek Banas, Daniel Bourke, Nicholas Renotte, Mosh, Corey Schafer, Tech with Tim, Clever Programmer, Angela Yu, Academind, and Javascript Mastery.

Specialized in Network Security and Network Servers where I learned Cybersecurity best practices, how to manage and maintain networks and servers. Gained experience troubleshooting and configuring servers in Windows CLI, Linux Bash, Windows Active Directory, VMWare, and Docker containers.

work.title: Data Analyst
work.description: Analyzed large datasets to identify trends, extract meaningful insights and help make informed business decisions. Utilizing tools such as Excel, SQL and Power BI to present findings via interactive data visualizations and pivot table reports. Implemented advanced Excel functions to organize and present data effectively.

work.title: Data Analytics Consultant
work.description: Demonstrated coding abilities with multiple languages including Python, SQL, and JavaScript. Designed, created, updated, and maintained SQL databases including tables, structures, views and stored procedures. Wrote queries to store, sort, and retrieve a wide range of data. Devised business dashboards using Excel for individual clients looking to map out their business data. Data visualization through Power BI and Tableau. Managed data warehousing on AWS, Azure, and GCP.

work.title: Datacenter Analyst
work.description: Built, racked and cabled server enclosers in a neat and timely manner. Worked with Arista, Dell, HP, Sanmina, and Cisco equipment. Provided assistance with break/fix related tasks. Ran fiber cables from endpoints back to switches. Analyze, test, troubleshoot, and evaluate existing network. Performed network maintenance to ensure networks operate correctly with minimal interruption and documented network related activities or tasks.

skills.name: Google Cloud Platform & Amazon Web Services

projects.title: My Certifications
projects.category: Includes Google, AWS, Coursera and FreeCodeCamp certs

projects.title: My Machine Learning Projects
projects.category: Collection of my ML & DL projects

testimonials.text: Here is where I should write something nice someone said about me..

This Kevin Gastelum kid must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of College and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
